title: Divvy Route Optimizer
oneLiner: Route optimization system for bike-share maintenance vans using TSP algorithms and real-time traffic data
overview: A production-ready web application that optimizes routes for Divvy bike-share maintenance vans across 600+ stations in Chicago. Solves the Traveling Salesman Problem using real-time traffic data and weather conditions to minimize route completion time. Built as a React SPA with sophisticated algorithm implementations and external API integrations.
highlights: Implemented time-optimized 2-opt TSP solver that considers real-time traffic data
Built weather-aware route planning with OpenWeather API integration and driving condition assessment
Developed 0/1 Knapsack solver for capacity-constrained bike collection optimization
Created multi-driver optimization system with greedy load-balancing algorithm
Built comprehensive analytics dashboard with route metrics and weather impact visualization
Implemented undo/redo functionality with history tracking for route editing
Designed fallback system that works fully offline with estimated calculations

redactions: API keys should be kept in .env file (not committed)
Station data uses real locations but generated bike inventory for demo
CS 440 course project - contains demo/mock data
